twitch_info.title: â­ TAPPER â­-> GENKI -> PEPPER -> Shapeland FINAL BOSS!!!

message.body: hi gl PridePog
alicen20W
nah its fine
did you want me to secret backseat you
there is a secret on this screen, not on that wall
the structure of this game is 2 halves then a final stage for any%, then a final final stage for 100%
each of the two halves have a secret item and secret boss
the final any% stage just has a secret boss
and there's no secrets in final stage
i have gotten literal death threats over fangames i have made in 2017, if you wanna say "man this jump sucks" i will not care lmfao
the community has gotten a lot better yeah
sorry for bringing it up i was just trying to convey i really don't mind if you say part of a game is bad
also you can fix the frame stutters by setting the priority of the game to high in task manager, idk if you have already
go to the Details tab
find the exe
right click
priority -> high
the one that is larger
one is just the audio player (that's how gms works)
speaking of funky gms stuff
this was made in an older version of Verve engine that didn't limit the volume slider in the options
meaning you can set the volume below 0%
and above 100%
below 0% is just more silence, like it won't absorb noise
but above 100% does amplify the game
you gotta do it in the pause menu
like, in game
salt was basically entirely kirby's return to dreamland
there's maybe like, two songs that aren't
and one of them is guy rock
this is like, the dedicated grassland trap stage
there will still be traps, but this is the only one where it's the only focus
a bit yeah
that and also a bit of other yo-yo games
like Time characters
consider: you can trigger that before going for the secret
that is the last trap of the save
a good trap game keeps you paranoid, a bad trap game makes you frustrated
i enjoy the feeling of "ok, how will this end badly"
it's interesting to set an expectation of what will happen and then have the maker come out of left field and do something completely different
like, 99% of fangame players don't enjoy when the spike in the ceiling falls down
a bad trap here would be making the spikes above you fall down
that's what would be expected
at least to me
this is the secret boss entrance
the pit was always there
you're going above that single right spike
on the left wall
above the pit
the spike that went away came back
something like what you played yesterday with Erik's game would be like going out to eat at a fancy restaraunt
games like Salt are like eating at McDonalds
my goal with this was to try and be like, a Red Robin or something
not fast food, not gormet
the good align for that is the left wall when you exit
like, touch the left wall in the room with the button
you cannot die here unless you press Q or R
there is an invisible block formation
get to the warp
all of the visuals in this game are either engine assets or stuff i made
don't press r
i mean like you can
it'll still save you
but r = flash
this is a Salt reference yes
in this specific case not really anything other than trying to be more vertical than standard corridor needle
all of the songs in this come from the "Starry Sky" album trilogy
yeah, gimme a sec
The Large Concert of the Starry Sky: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rVG98-Wmrro&list=PLokgZj2u2Z1_TIScUNYOFsFLGnof3c3Ls&pp=0gcJCacEOCosWNin
The Grand Finale of the Starry Sky: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yHNEoDuHvDg&list=PLokgZj2u2Z18Xn9WheNLYU5G1TfKALuoP
Concert of the Starry Sky: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BOTqJORHSBw&list=PLokgZj2u2Z18kd2ifBTzVDmRfbQthbRlX
i'm just linking all three
all three of these are kirby remix albums
i have, yes
i've joked with ava about hosting a masquarade event before
i.e. an event where your game would be judged not only on if it's good or not, but how closely in style it is to someone else
like, say "I am going to make a game that feels like it was made by kittygame"
and then make it
it's actually been done before (the event)
that's where Permanence Zero and 8possible come from
i'm saying to do it again
that event was like, forever ago
i joke about it with ava though because she's made Appreciation (inspired by æ°´é³¥) and i've made this (inspired by ãƒ¨ãƒ¼ãƒ¨ãƒ¼) and games inspired by wonderful and Kale
none of the characters in this have names
i've joked about going from Salt -> Sanipalt and Pepper -> Penipper or something similar
but there's like, no official names
i don't know if it ever gets officially used, I know it gets used in Z3 though
each of the secret bosses is just one attack, typically with some form of tomfoolery going on
this attack is just a random fruit spray, but the speed of them is equal to a sine wave pattern
so it goes slower and faster
late 2022
oh i guess i lied the items are from kirby
i didn't make those
i said i didn't make engine assets ðŸ˜­
you have gotten all of the secrets in Stage 1-A
(the -A is because this is the top path, compared to the bottom path)
idk if i'd say "looking"
there's a lot of people who look at them though and have a good inspiration from them
i meant in terms of "are there people in the community looking for old fangames"
there's something to be said about being able to differ between "bad design" and "old design"
like, Crimson has a lot of good design choices
but they're old design
that most people wouldn't make today
it also has a bunch of bad design choices though
which is why it's appealing to make something inspired by it
but without the bad design choices
so you can have just the decisions it would have made at the time
that you don't see today
for me personally i like how simplistic old design is
you can look at something and instantly know what's going on
which lets you do stuff like traps more easily
modern triggers and traps tend to be complicated endeavors with multiple steps and actions
older triggers and traps tend to be "think fast!"
there is a secret on the first save
don't shoot the second save on this screen
the secret is the secret boss one, i.e. more complicated
you need to get to the save, but don't shoot it
i tried to follow the mindset of secret items are just hug the wall, and secret bosses are more involved and complicated to get to
jump into the button
you haven't missed any secrets yet
this stage i got a bit cheeky with the fact that touching the spikes in secrets =/= dying
the bosses in this are like, inspired by salt (omg no way) while also taking what they did and doing something different with it
like, this boss in Salt was also similar to this, but the fruit had no vertical movement
there's a clip on FM from before i transitioned where i raced hyoka, beat this boss, then died before saving after it due to a bug in Nekoron engine
in Salt
www.twitch.tv/fangamemarathon/clip/TardySpeedyGoatSmoocherZ
this is the clip
for context: in Nekoron engine, triggers only reset when you press R, and touching the spikes in secrets =/= reseting
meaning if you beat this boss first try, that happens
it was close, i think i lost but i got the more clips
shoutouts to https://www.twitch.tv/fangamemarathon/clip/CulturedCulturedPidgeonPicoMause
that's like 5 minutes into the 6 minute avoidance
Penipper
the trap at the bottom of this drop is specifically to mess with people who have played Salt
Salt has an identical setup where it does the opposite trap
the left spike flies down
instead of the down spike
bonk and hit the button after bonking
i didn't stick to it 100%
each Stage 1 was meant to be like, 90% similar
Stage 2 is like, 75% similar (instead of buttons in salt it was just platforms and triggers)
you haven't missed a secret
Stage 3 is around like 33% similar
you can get the secret item from either this save or the next save
like, an example of old design vs. bad/outdated design ig
in something like Salt this platform would just be constantly moving
meanwhile here it waits for you
to get on it
they didn't have the knowledge that that was really bad and unfun back then
but also one bad idea doesn't make the entire game bad
because of the position and size of the trigger, from the final save you can trigger that and run right
that spike that moves down is important
fair, that's a completely understandable view
you can shoot through spikes
alicen20Gafro
in Salt, you were unable to access each stage after beating them, despite each stage having a secret and requiring them for 100%
in this, once you beat a stage, a warp appears that takes you to it in the hub
meaning if you miss Secret 3 you can go directly to Stage 3
instead of needing to play through stages 1 and 2 again

hey Kayin
It was good! Street Fighter 6

they got past 2? i know they were stuck on that for a while
there are like, 20+ versions of Street Fighter 2
but think about how rough old fangame are but how that probably has some of its own charm, compared to like modern stuff
she's joking but its a lot
The newer ones are more interesting to me
Slightly different group
the venn diagram overlaps though
But even then, Melee and Ultimate are way different even though they're the same
hell yeah
I built my own arcade stick lol
you do not know pain until you try to hit a quarter circle on a genesis d-pad
i played MK1 on genesis as a kid (secondhand from my mom)
You buy the parts for the buttons, buy a little board to connect them to and then build a box
it used to be the cheaper option
now if I had to get a new one I'd probably just buy one
100-200$ is like the like... basic range, but up to like 400-500
They play on pad and call me a boomer
pad is more viable now than it used to be
but yeah alice idk I think genesis pad is easier than snes???
for some things
oh gosh

xd
But yeah to go back to old fangames like they're cool but part of me is like "Oh they don't get the humor of IWBTG"
the newer ones feel more their own thing
yeah! They weren't wrong just ahead of the curve
a lot of humor through fangames for me comes through absurdity, even in the OG guy, though i know in OG guy that isn't the main prupose
people just don't make the angry spike monster anymore
I love the angry spike monster, it's so unnecessary
it was my friend April's idea so she loves it still to this day

I feel like it's unsurprising that IWBTG fangames attract people with like... organizational OCD, which leads to some of this tuff.

I like all the colors people have introduced.
by even sheerer chance, you can also do it while upside down
